alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:26PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wasatch and central Utah Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Mapleton to near West Mountain. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Heber City, Orem, Lehi, Spanish Fork, Pleasant Grove, Springville, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Heber, Lindon, Alpine, Mapleton, Salem, Daniel, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Wasatch Mountain State Park and Palmyra. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 248 and 281. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 178. US Route 40 between mile markers 13 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
